original_title: Sri Lanka stocks close up, turnover low
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka stocks closed up on Friday, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
The All Share Price Index was up 0.04 percent, or 4.41 points, at 10,526.
The S&P SL20 index of liquid stocks was down 0.07 percent, or 2.00 points at 2,981.

The diversified financials sector contributed 103 million of this: including Capital Alliance Plc (32 mn), First Capital Holdings Plc (28 mn), LOLC Holdings Plc (13 mn), and First Capital Treasuries PLC (10 mn).
Top positive contributors to the ASPI included SMB Finance Plc (up at 0.60), Hemas Holdings Plc (up at 71.00), and Dipped Products Plc (up at 28.40).
Shares of Commercial Development Company Plc, which announced a dividend, traded down (109.25) in the day.
There was a net foreign inflow of 34 million (Colombo/Nov24/2023)
